perturbation.original_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement, but not without agreement from the Developer. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur.
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives the client the 'unilateral right to cancel' the agreement, while the modified text states that the Client cannot cancel the agreement 'but not without agreement from the Developer' creating a contradiction about the client's right to termination.

perturbation.original_text: 11. WORK FOR HIRE. (a) Work for Hire. The Developer expressly acknowledges and agrees that any all proprietary materials prepared by the Developer under this Agreement shall be considered "works for hire" and the exclusive property of the Client unless otherwise specified. These items shall include, but shall not be limited to, any and all deliverables resulting from the Developer's Services or contemplated by this Agreement, all tangible results and proceeds of the Services, works in progress, records, diagrams, notes, drawings, specifications, schematics, documents, designs, improvements, inventions, discoveries, developments, trademarks,, licenses, trade secrets, customer lists, databases, software, programs, middleware, applications, and solutions conceived, made, or discovered by the Developer, solely or in collaboration with others, during the Term of this Agreement relating in any manner to the Developer's Services.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. WORK FOR HIRE. (a) Work for Hire. The Developer expressly acknowledges and agrees that any all proprietary materials prepared by the Developer under this Agreement shall be considered "works for hire" and the exclusive property of the Client, even if specified otherwise. These items shall include, but shall not be limited to, any and all deliverables resulting from the Developer's Services or contemplated by this Agreement, all tangible results and proceeds of the Services, works in progress, records, diagrams, notes, drawings, specifications, schematics, documents, designs, improvements, inventions, discoveries, developments, trademarks,, licenses, trade secrets, customer lists, databases, software, programs, middleware, applications, and solutions conceived, made, or discovered by the Developer, solely or in collaboration with others, during the Term of this Agreement relating in any manner to the Developer's Services.
perturbation.explanation: The original states that any and all proprietary materials prepared by the developer will be the client's unless otherwise specified. The changed text omits this clause which means that all proprietary material is the client's, regardless of specification which is a contradiction of the original.

perturbation.original_text: 14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. (a) No Intellectual Property Infringement by Developer. The Developer hereby represents and warrants that the use and proposed use of the Application by the Client or any third party does not and shall not infringe, and the Developer has not received any notice, complaint, threat, or claim alleging infringement of, any trademark, copyright, patent, trade secrets, industrial design, or other rights of any third party in the Application, and the use of the Application will not include any activity that may constitute "passing off." To the extent the Application infringes on the rights of any such third party, the Developer shall obtain a license or consent from such third party permitting the use of the Application. It is hereby stated, the Application developed under this agreement is the exclusive worldwide sole property of Client.
perturbation.changed_text: 14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. (a) No Intellectual Property Infringement by Developer. The Developer hereby represents and warrants that the use and proposed use of the Application by the Client or any third party may infringe, and the Developer may receive notice, complaint, threat, or claim alleging infringement of, any trademark, copyright, patent, trade secrets, industrial design, or other rights of any third party in the Application, and the use of the Application may include any activity that may constitute "passing off." To the extent the Application infringes on the rights of any such third party, the Developer shall not obtain a license or consent from such third party permitting the use of the Application. It is hereby stated, the Application developed under this agreement is not the exclusive worldwide sole property of Client.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces contradictions about IP infringement claims and ownership, as well as whether the application infringes on third-party rights. This will increase confusion about the developer's responsibility and ownership rights.
